text: US media reports say Donald Trump's
former national security adviser Michael
Flynn who's admitted lying to the FBI
about his contacts with Russia is
prepared to give testimony that
implicates the president's son-in-law
Jared Kushner well the White House says
mr. Flynn has implicated nobody but
himself in the investigation into
alleged collusion between Moscow and mr.
Trump's team before he came to power
Laura Baker reports Michael Flynn a
retired three-star general let the court
in Washington to a familiar chant lock
him up he'd once encouraged Donald
Trump's supporters to use a similar
version against rival Hillary Clinton
the 58 you don't played a key part in
mr. Trump's campaign and often traveled
with him if I did 1/10 1/10 of what she
did I would be in jail today he was
rewarded with the post of national
security adviser but was forced to
resign after just 23 days when his
contacts with Russia to discuss US
sanctions were disclosed on the 29th of
December Michael Flynn spoke to the
Russian ambassador and the phone in the
first of a series of calls on the 15th
of January vice president Mike Pence
said that sanctions were not discussed
in those calls only after the 9th of
February when a newspaper revealed
general Flint did discuss sanctions did
pressure increase and Michael Flynn lost
his job as part of his guilty plea
prosecutors said mr. Flynn's now
cooperating with the investigation u.s.
media claims he'll testify that senior
members of the Trump team including mr.
Trump's son and lured Jared Kushner
directed him to make contact with
Russian officials the White House is now
trying to distance itself from Michael
Flynn's actions and the lies he told to
the FBI but having reached a plea
bargain to cooperate what else has mr.
Flynn told the inquiry and what further
revelations are to come Laura Baker BBC
News Washington
